pageContext.claim: “We’re reducing our troops in Germany because it’s costing us a lot of money and they’re delinquent on their payments. You know, they’re delinquent on their NATO payments. They owe a lot of money. Germany owes a lot of money. They don't pay their bills.”
pageContext.analysis: Since 2006, each NATO member has had a guideline of spending at least 2 percent of gross domestic product on defense spending, with a goal of reaching that level by 2024. Germany is not making payments to NATO and thus does not owe "a lot of money." It's wrong to claim Germany doesn't "pay their bills."
